description: Static bay manufacturing where modules remain in assigned bay while trade crews rotate through

phases.name: Chassis & Floor Deck
workActivities: Receive and position steel chassis frame in bay
Install floor joists (I-joists per engineered plans)
Install blocking, bridging, and rim boards
Install subfloor sheathing (glued and screwed per schedule)
Mark layout lines for walls, plumbing penetrations
Install any below-floor MEP (drain lines, supply stubs)

phases.name: Wall Framing & Sheathing
workActivities: Install bottom plates (pressure-treated where required)
Set pre-fabricated wall panels OR install SIP panels per engineered plans
Install top plates and tie-down connections
Install window and door bucks/frames
Install exterior sheathing (if not pre-installed on panels)
Apply weather-resistive barrier (WRB) per manufacturer instructions
Flash window and door openings per WRB manufacturer details

phases.name: Roof/Ceiling Framing
workActivities: Install ceiling joists or roof trusses per engineered plans
Install ridge board, rafters, and collar ties (if stick-framed roof)
Install roof sheathing (nailing per high-wind schedule if applicable)
Install roofing underlayment
Install fascia, soffit framing, and ventilation provisions
Temporary roof protection installed pending roofing material

phases.name: MEP Rough-In & Testing
workActivities: ELECTRICAL: Install electrical panel and main service entrance provisions
ELECTRICAL: Run branch circuits per NEC 2023 and approved plans
ELECTRICAL: Install boxes, supports, and device rings
ELECTRICAL: Pull and terminate wiring
ELECTRICAL: Install smoke/CO detector wiring and interconnects
PLUMBING: Install DWV system per IPC 2021
PLUMBING: Install water supply piping (PEX manifold system)
PLUMBING: Install water heater connections (tankless units)
PLUMBING: Stub out fixture connections
HVAC: Install mini-split line sets and electrical connections
HVAC: Install interior air handler units
HVAC: Install ventilation provisions (HRV/ERV if applicable)
HVAC: Install range hood ductwork
HVAC: Install bathroom exhaust ductwork
TESTING: Water supply pressure test (100 PSI, 15 min, no drop)
TESTING: DWV test (10 ft water head OR 5 PSI air, 15 min)
TESTING: Electrical continuity and ground fault testing
phases.referenceITP: ITP-E-01, ITP-E-02, ITP-P-01 through ITP-P-04, ITP-M-01 through ITP-M-03

phases.name: Insulation & Air Sealing
workActivities: Install cavity insulation (batt or blown) per IECC 2021 requirements
Achieve RESNET Grade I installation (no gaps, voids, compression)
Install continuous air barrier per energy code
Seal all penetrations (electrical boxes, plumbing, HVAC)
Install vapor retarder where required by climate zone
Insulate rim joists and band boards
Document insulation R-values and installation quality

phases.name: Drywall & Interior Shell
workActivities: Hang drywall on ceilings and walls per fastener schedule
Install moisture-resistant drywall in wet areas (green board or equivalent)
Install fire-rated assemblies where required (garage separation)
Tape and mud all joints (3-coat finish minimum)
Install corner bead at all outside corners
Sand to Level 4 finish (Level 5 where specified)
Cut openings for electrical boxes, HVAC registers
inspectionCriteria: No visible defects (bubbles, ridges, nail pops)

phases.name: Interior Finish & Trim
workActivities: PAINT: Prime all drywall surfaces
PAINT: Apply finish coats per color schedule
FLOORING: Install LVP, tile, or carpet per specifications
FLOORING: Install transitions and thresholds
TRIM: Install interior doors and hardware
TRIM: Install base, casing, and crown molding
TRIM: Install closet shelving and rods
CABINETS: Install kitchen and bathroom cabinets
CABINETS: Install countertops and backsplash
ELECTRICAL: Install devices (outlets, switches, fixtures)
PLUMBING: Install fixtures (sinks, toilets, faucets)
HVAC: Install registers and grilles
Install appliances

phases.name: Final Inspection & Pre-Ship
workActivities: Complete punch list items from Phase 7
Final cleaning and detail
QA Manager conducts comprehensive final inspection
TPIA final inspection (coordinate with ICC NTA)
Final blower door test (if not completed at HP-5)
Complete all Traveler documentation
Assemble module documentation package
Install exterior finishes (siding, roofing, trim)
Apply weatherproofing for transport
Apply DOH Construction Insignia (QA Manager only)
inspectionCriteria: All previous hold points signed off
phases.insigniaNote: The QA Manager is the SOLE PERSON authorized to apply the DOH Construction Insignia (Red Label)

holdTypes.description: Work cannot proceed to the next phase until NCR is resolved
holdTypes.example: Module SN-2026-003 held at Phase 4 in Bay 2 pending plumbing pressure test failure resolution

holdTypes.description: Specific trade cannot continue, but parallel work by other trades may proceed if not affected
holdTypes.example: Electrical rough-in on hold pending wire sizing clarification; plumbing crew continues DWV installation

holdTypes.description: All work in bay stops. Used for structural defects, safety concerns, or systemic issues
holdTypes.example: Structural member found undersized; engineering evaluation required before any further work
